page.title: 16CUSTOMS/LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The first Flitch Trials were at Little Dunmow,now it is held at Talberd's Ley by The Downs every 4 years.At the ceremony,married couples have to convince a jury that the didn't regret their marriage nor argued for a year and a day.The winning couple would be given a flitch of bacon and paraded through the town.The chairing ceremony started at the Town Hall which was built in 1578 and enlarged in the 19th century,it houses a very unique clock. The Flitch Trials started in 1445 and the next Trials are in 1988.During the trials there is a country and antiques fair,craft display,funfair,children's games,and an hisorical pageant.Each year there is a carnival organised by Dunmow Round Table to raise money for charity and provide entertainment for the people of Dunmow,the festivities are held on our school field.
